Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red/brown-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is red-grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous substance, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.194)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36472) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36472)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 332 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13518 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
